data:
Command: `ping google.com`
Example: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to google.com.

Command: `ping -c 5 google.com`
Example: Sends 5 ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to google.com and then exits.

Command: `ping -i 2 google.com`
Example: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to google.com every 2 seconds.

Command: `ping -t 64 google.com`
Example: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to google.com with a Time To Live (TTL) of 64.

Command: `ping -s 1000 google.com`
Example: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets of size 1000 bytes to google.com.

Command: `ping -4 google.com`
Example: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets using IPv4 only to google.com.

Command: `ping -6 2001:db8::1`
Example: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets using IPv6 only to 2001:db8::1.

Command: `ping -f google.com`
Example: Performs a flood ping to google.com (requires root privileges).

Command: `ping -v google.com`
Example: Provides verbose output during the ping operation to google.com.

Command: `ping -w 5 google.com`
Example: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to google.com and exits after 5 seconds, regardless of the number of packets sent or received.

Command: `tcpdump host sundown`
Example: Shows all packets to/from sundown.

Command: `tcpdump host helios and \( hot or ace \)`
Example: Shows traffic between helios and hot OR ace.

Command: `tcpdump ip host ace and not helios`
Example: Shows IP packets between ace and any host except helios.

Command: `tcpdump 'gateway snup and (port ftp or ftp-data)'`
Example: Shows FTP traffic through gateway snup.

Command: `tcpdump -c 100 host example.com`
Example: Captures 100 packets to/from example.com then exits.

Command: `tcpdump -w capture.pcap`
Example: Saves all captured packets to capture.pcap.

Command: `tcpdump -r capture.pcap`
Example: Reads and displays packets from capture.pcap.

Command: `tcpdump -i eth0 port 80`
Example: Captures HTTP traffic on interface eth0.

Command: `tcpdump -e`
Example: Includes link-layer headers in the output.

Command: `tcpdump -vvv`
Example: Provides very verbose output, including detailed protocol information.
